dc:title: On Pilgrimage - June 1968
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: A series of diary-like entries describing protests in New York regarding peace, race, and the closing of Sydenham Hospital. Interspersed are events of friends, including the confirmation of Peggy Baird and a wedding at the farm. Reports on plans for the summer, including a speaking engagement at the Pax conference and attendance at the Poor People's Campaign protests in Washington, DC.
